intro: Iris longipetala var. montana, commonly known as the mountain iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, supporting showy blue to purple flowers with a distinctive three-parted structure. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its striking floral display and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
